channel.title: Comments on: NPM As A Blocker

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2014/03/21/npm-blocker/#comment-4189">julien51</a>.
Hence the last line "if it is code that you depend on in production then it should be in your source control repo".
item.content:encoded:
In reply to julien51.

Hence the last line “if it is code that you depend on in production then it should be in your source control repo”.

item.title: By: julien51
item.dc:creator: julien51
item.description:
That is all very true, but I also think it is not a problem if you check out the dependencies in your repository.
Mikeal says it better I can: http://www.futurealoof.com/posts/nodemodules-in-git.html
item.content:encoded:
That is all very true, but I also think it is not a problem if you check out the dependencies in your repository.

Mikeal says it better I can: http://www.futurealoof.com/posts/nodemodules-in-git.html
